meanings.definition: A small, round seed used for planting or eating.
meanings.sent1: I planted a burseed in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The burseed was delicious when roasted.
meanings.sent3: The burseed rolled away and played hide-and-seek in the soil.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like burseeds, spreading and taking root in everyone's minds.
meanings.sent5: The burseed shimmered in the sunlight, promising new life.

meanings.definition: To plant seeds in the ground.
meanings.sent1: She will burseed the flowerbed tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: It is important to burseed at the right depth.
meanings.sent3: He burseeded so many seeds, the garden looked like a patchwork quilt.
meanings.sent4: The farmer burseeded hope in the dry earth, praying for rain.
meanings.sent5: As she burseeded, she whispered words of encouragement to the seeds.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that produces seeds.
meanings.sent1: The burseed of the sunflower is ready for harvest.
meanings.sent2: The burseed of the maple tree fluttered in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the burseed for a nut and tried to crack it open.
meanings.sent4: She was the burseed of creativity in the group, inspiring others with her ideas.
meanings.sent5: The burseed of knowledge grew within him, ready to spread to others.
